title: Yinchuan
summary: Yinchuan (UK: /jɪnˈtʃwæn/, US: /-tʃwɑːn/;[4] simplified Chinese: 银川; traditional Chinese: 銀川; pinyin: Yínchuān) is the capital of the Ningxia Hui Autonomous Region, China,[5] and was capital of the Western Xia Empire of the Tanguts. It has an area of 8,874.61 km2 (3,426.51 sq mi) and a total population of 2.29 million.[6] Its built-up area is home to 1,487,561 inhabitants spread between three urban districts.[6] The city's name literally means "silver river".
